solution_line_template: Maria wants to pay {canvas_multiplier} * {brushes_cost} = $<<{canvas_multiplier}*{brushes_cost}={canvas_cost}>>{canvas_cost} for the canvas.

Maria needs {paint_liters_needed} liters of paint, so the cost of it would be {paint_cost_per_liter} * {paint_liters_needed} = $<<{paint_cost_per_liter}*{paint_liters_needed}={paint_cost}>>{paint_cost}.

So in total Maria will earn {selling_price} - {paint_cost} - {canvas_cost} - {brushes_cost} = $<<{selling_price}-{paint_cost}-{canvas_cost}-{brushes_cost}={net_earnings}>>{net_earnings} if she will be able to sell the painting at the mentioned price.
